intro: Tragia zenkeri, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical with a rough texture. Tragia zenkeri is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
